column4: Meet Our Newest Canine Cadet Bessie! Bessie is a pit/mix and has been at the Beaumont Animal Care Shelter since October. Help her find her forever home! For Inquires: Call 409-838-3304 #Adopt #beaumontanimalcare #BeaumontPD
Are You Prepared? #free #business #schools #church #police #community #safety
Join us for our 53rd Citizens Police Academy! #police #community
Start your new year with us on Thursday, January 9, 2020 as we host our Police Community Forum. #beaumontpolicedepartment #community #workingtogether

Please join the BPD today, Tuesday, December 17 at 5:00 p.m. on the front steps of the station (255 College Street) as we send-off Blue Santa for his Toy Delivery. This year, BPD’s Blue Santa Program will be providing Christmas toys for 200 children. See our FB for more info.
Meet our newest BPD Canine Cadet "Otter" Available for Adoption! Please call Beaumont Animal Care at 409-838-3304 for details! #beaumontpolice #Beaumont #beaumontanimalcare #puppy #adoptme #Police
Update ** All lanes of 347 are now open!
*Traffic Alert* BPD is working a fatality crash in the 6400 block of HWY 347. Both directions of travel are closed while the scene is under investigation. Please seek an alternate route.

**Suspect Alert** Can you identify these suspects?? The 2 ladies committed theft at a local retail store. If you know who they are, send us a message, call BPD at 409-832-1234 or SETX Crime Stoppers at 409-833-TIPS (8477). You can also download the P3 Tips app to submit your tip.
Our Cadet Scout is still looking for his forever home! Please contact Beaumont Animal Care for details! 409-838-3304 #BPDCANINECADET #Beaumontpolice #beaumont #puppy #ADOPT #Beaumontanimalcare

We are so excited that shortly after introducing our "Canine Cadet" Program with our first sweet baby, NIA.. She has been adopted!!!! #BPDCanineCadets #BeaumontAnimalCare #ADPOTED Be on the lookout for our next Canine Cadet that is needing a forever home!! #rescue #adopt

Introducing "Nia" our first BPD Canine Cadet!!! If you are interested in adopting Nia please reach our friends at Beaumont Animal Care at (409) 838-3304. #beaumontanimalcare #BPDcaninecadets #beaumontpolice

Tune into Beaumont Police Facebook page today at 12:10 as we feature our #BPDCANINECADETS on our segment "Taking a Break with Beaumont PD" featuring special guest, #Beaumontanimalcare! #ADOPT #dogs #police #beaumont

Did you know...through BPD's Cops & Kids Reading Program, our Officers read to elementary students at more than 15 schools, reaching over 500 children, each month?!?! Our goals are to help promote literacy and a love for reading, while also cultivating positive relationships
Join us at Starbucks today, (Thursday, Oct. 3) from 4:00-6:00 p.m. for Coffee with a Cop! Our #GiftofLife #PinkPatrol Car will be there! Come check it out!!

BPD would like to congratulate Det. Mike Nixon and Sgt. Tim Bean on their retirement. Det. Nixon served The City of Beaumont for 25 yrs (the last 15, as an Officer w/ BPD). Sgt. Bean served at the BPD for 22 yrs. Thank you for your service and best of luck in your retirement!
Beaumont Police Officers & Honor Guard Members attending funeral services for slain Harris County Deputy, Sandeep Dhaliwal.
https://beaumonttexas.gov/beaumont-police-department-is-driving-out-breast-cancer-in-october-with-the-pink-patrol-project/ #BPDPINKPATROLCAR #Giftoflife #BeaumontPolice #BeaumontTX
Here is a direct link for yesterday’s city council meeting. A lot of questions and concerns were addressed. The meeting focused on Tropical Storm Imelda.

These are a few pictures of your Emergency Management team. Included are Situations Unit Team Leader Sgt. Mike Custer, Senator Ted Cruz, Admiral John Nadeau, Judge Jeff Branick, Congressman Randy Weber and Mayor Beck Ames.
Assessment will continue tomorrow. Thank you for all the calls. Please keep reporting. The map below is not the only areas we are assessing. This is areas with highest concentration.
***The Damage Assessment Reporting Hotline will have the operating hours of 7:00 a.m.- 6:00 p.m. until further notice***

Recovery efforts are underway, our city's Solid Waste Dept. has begun heavy trash pick-up. We would like to remind our citizens to use this pic as a guide. Please assist by not parking vehicles on the street in front of debris piles & DO NOT place debris on top of fire hydrants.
Please note this Damage Assessment Hotline is for damaged structures inside the city limits of Beaumont.
Traffic Alert from @TxDOTBeaumont regarding SH 124 (Fannett Road) at Hillebrandt Bayou. https://twitter.com/TxDOTBeaumont/status/1175559686059429888

Rumor Control: There has NOT been a Federal Disaster Declaration issued for Tropical Storm Imelda. Therefore, NO DSNAP (Disaster Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program) benefits are being offered at ANY locations in the city. There are NO shelters offering ANY DSNAP benefits.

There are NO evacuation orders for ANY residents inside the city limits of Beaumont. PLEASE refer to our Beaumont Police Facebook Page on the rumor control referencing false info about “gates opening” on the Neches River. Misinformation hurts us all!
We are receiving requests for road information. Please visit http://www.drivetexas.org and TXDOT-Beaumont's Twitter for up-to-date road conditions and closures.

Evacuation operations have been suspended from 7:30 p.m. - 7:30 a.m. Rescue crews will continue to respond to life-threatening situations only. If you are still in an area with standing water, seek higher ground and shelter in place. Be patient & only call 911 for emergencies.
The Civic Center Shelter has been established for those who have been rescued from high water. There are limited resources available at the shelter.

The Jefferson County mandatory evacuation order recently posted & shared from the Jefferson County Office of Emergency Management is being amended for clarification. At this time, there are NO mandatory evacuations in place for any areas WITHIN the city limits of Beaumont.

Please DO NOT respond to the Civic Center with donations. We are in the process of coordinating a donation drop-off location, where items can be sorted and organized. Continue to follow our social media accounts for accurate, up-to-date information.

Hundreds of requests for evacuations may take several hours. CITY COORDINATED resources will pick you up & bring you to a safe designated location. Life safety is our #1 priority. Remain calm & be strong as we work diligently to get to every person who has called us for help.

As of 1:00 p.m. we have received over 760 weather related calls for service. Please understand that the high water rescues that are on-going are prioritized by immediate threat to life safety and medical emergencies.
Please follow @TxDOTBeaumont for updated information on road closures! We still want to reiterate the importance of staying off of the roads, which are still flooded!!
Thank you to Ralph & Kacoo’s-Beaumont for donating 200 meals to our first responders today! We appreciate you!
We are already using BISD Buses to do that. Unfortunately, there are many areas that even buses can not get to which is our biggest problem.

We are encouraging everyone to stay off of the roads entirely. Almost all service roads are flooded including many areas throughout the city. Once the water recedes and we can assess hazardous situations we are pleading with the public to stay off of the roads.
No. The city is closed and non-essential services are suspended. No trash service or public transportation. Please stay off of the roads!
This is not accurate information. Please only share information that is from vetted sources such as our social media accounts
Rumor Control: Be advised, the City of Beaumont's water system is fully functional and operating. Please only share information that is from vetted sources such as our social media accounts.

911 Lines are NOT down! 911/311 is receiving an extremely high volume of calls! If you are needing NON-CRITICAL assistance please use 311. 911 lines need to be reserved for life threatening emergencies! Please only share information that is from vetted sources such our twitter!
Please be advised there may be downed power lines in some areas. These live lines may be laying in water, which can carry an electric current. Please stay off of the roads!

We are experiencing a high volume of calls to our 911/311 center. Please be patient, we are working extremely hard to get to those who need help! As daylight emerges, PLEASE DO NOT get out on the roads! As of 8:00 a.m. there have been over 590 flood related calls for service.
We would like to remind the public to please only share information that is verified and from a vetted source. Stay tuned to our Facebook and Twitter, as well as local media for accurate information!

Most service roads are flooded and access to Interstate 10 and Highway 69 is extremely limited. The City of Beaumont has closed non-essential offices for Thursday, September 19, 2019. Lamar University, LIT and BISD Schools are also closed.
If your home is taking water (above a few inches) and you are able to safely get to the main breaker to turn off the power, do that to prevent electrical hazards.

Please DO NOT leave your residence and attempt to operate a vehicle on flooded roads. Move to higher ground and await evacuation/rescue. More people lose their life during flooding events by leaving a safe location (which may be taking on water) and driving into flooded streets.

The 911 operations center has experienced a heavy call load with over 250 high water rescues and 270 evacuation requests. If there is an immediate threat to life safety, call 911. For non-emergency calls please call 409-832-1234.

The Office of Emergency Management has activated the Emergency Operations Center due to heavy rainfall and flooding from TS Imelda. In the last 12 hours, we have averaged 12+ ins of rainfall, w/ some areas w/up to 20 ins. The NWS estimates 5-10 more ins of rainfall now until Noon

Due to the continuing weather conditions caused by Tropical Storm Imelda, the City of BMT will close non-essential City offices, Thursday, September 19, 2019. Non-essential services will not be available, which includes trash pickup and transit services.

Please shelter in place and seek high ground. DO NOT drive a vehicle on BMT roads. Most access roads are under water. Rescue/Evacuation requests are being prioritized. Please only call 911 for life threatening situations.

Today, The Beaumont Police Department remembers Sergeant Michael "Mike" Lane who died in the Line of Duty on September 16, 2004. Sergeant Lane was 54 years old and had served with the Beaumont Police Department for 32 years.
Please Share! #CanineCadets #BeaumontPolice #BeaumontAnimalCare
Our Narcotics Unit is doin' work!!
Happy National Dog Day! #beaumontpolice #NationalDogDay2019
Save the Date: Beaumont @beaumont_police Cops and Kids Halloween Carnival will be hosted at the Beaumont Civic Center on October 26th. Hope to see you there!
Don't Forget!! #TONIGHT

BPD arrested 2 additional suspects for the murder of Jesse Rodriguez (Saturday, 8/17/19) at Dowlen & Eastex. Nayah Mayfield, a 20 year old Port Arthur Woman and Xaiver Parrish, a 20 year old Groves Man were just arrested. Martin Pettway was also arrested earlier this afternoon.
**Update** All lanes of College are back open!

**Traffic Alert 2** College Street Westbound from I-10 to 23rd is closed due to an 18 wheeler losing a heavy load of pipe. It will be closed until crews can re-load the pipes using a crane. Please find an alternate route (Washington, Liberty, Calder).
All lanes of I-10 are now back open

**Traffic Alert** HAZMAT Spill on IH-10 Westbound at the Purple Heart Bridge. Find an alternate route. I-10 Westbound (coming into Beaumont from Orange County) will be closed for several hours until the roadway is cleared.

**Suspect Alert** Do you recognize this suspect?? BPD Fraud Detectives need your help identifying her. On 7-1-19 she passed a forged check at a local business. If you know her name call BPD 409-832-1234 or Southeast Texas Crime Stoppers at 409-833-TIPS (8477).
A special thanks to St. Anne Catholic School Girl Scouts!! We received boxes of cookies for Cookies for Heros! Thank you from everyone here at @beaumont_police #girlscouts

We would like to thank Teleflora and Williams Florist for choosing Beaumont PD to celebrate "Make Someone Smile Week." We received 400 mugs, plants, flowers, and balloons. It really did make us all Smile! Photo Credit: Chad Cooper/ The Examiner #Teleflora #williamsflorist

Today, BPD remembers Officer Walter Stansbury- killed in the line of duty on July 23, 1903. Officer Stansbury, responded to a call to assist an Officer who had been shot. As he approached the residence, the suspect shot him. Officer Stansbury was 33 years old & served 2yrs at BPD
https://beaumonttexas.gov/beaumont-police-arrest-homicide-suspect-2200-evalon/
Beaumont Police have taken a suspect into custody for the Homicide that occurred last night in the 2200 block of Evalon. Stay tuned to our twitter for additional information.
Wear Our Badge #Beaumontpolice #Police

Sgt. Custer speaking on Intelligence Led Policing & Predictive Analysis- BPD is taking proactive steps to predict when & where crime will occur & intercepting the criminals responsible! “If you see something that makes you go hmm, call it in” -Sgt. Custer See our FB for more
https://beaumonttexas.gov/bpd-arrests-3-suspects-for-aggravated-robbery-2730-e-lucas-dollar-general/ #busted #teamwork

Do you have info about this crime? 7/3/19- BPD responded to Forest Lawn Cemetery (4955 Pine) reference Burglary. Grounds keeper discovered 2 mausoleum tombs damaged & 1 casket removed from tomb & opened. Incident occurred between July 1-July 3. Call Crime Stoppers 409-833-8477
BPD is on the scene of a deceased person located in the Hillebrandt Bayou near Tyrrell Park Rd and Parkview.

We are actively monitoring the disturbance in the Gulf. While there is still uncertainty, we would like to take this time to encourage preparedness! Register for emergency alerts by calling 311, downloading the app on your smartphone or visiting http://www.beaumonttexas.gov/departments/eoc/

Beaumont Police and Beaumont Fire Rescue are on the scene of a House Fire in the 1400 block of Bolivar. At this time there is one confirmed fatality. As per standard protocol, this will be a joint investigation between BPD and BFR.
Thank you to the kind citizen who sent this amazing “get well” basket to the police station for K-9 Maximus! Officer Revia says he’s loving the balloon!
@Brentwalker2 It gets the message across ;) #oldschool

Celebrate Independence Day Responsibly! If you will be consuming alcohol, have a plan! * Designated Driver * Ride-Share Company (Uber/Lyft/Taxi) Buzzed driving is drunk driving! If you feel different, you drive different!
https://beaumonttexas.gov/beaumont-police-arrest-one-for-evading-arrest-following-multiple-burglaries-college-ih-10/

BPD has responded to numerous calls in the early morning hours in reference to a loud noise, causing windows and walls to rattle. We have obtained this statement from Exxon Mobil as it relates to the unusual activity. Please note this may occur over the next few days.
All lanes have re-opened!

Beaumont Police are on the scene of an Auto Pedestrian Fatality in the 3400 block of West Cardinal Drive, Southbound. Drivers are being diverted off of the highway at Fannett Road. This area of W. Cardinal will be closed for several hours. Please use caution!

Chief Singletary administrating the Oath of Office to 4 new Beaumont Police Officers and promoting one Officer to the rank of Sergeant! Congratulations to these Officers and their families on this special occasion!
**Suspect Alert** Please share! Do you recognize these suspects from the EZ Pawn smash & grab??? If so, call Beaumont Police at 409-832-1234 or Southeast Texas Crime Stoppers at 409-833-TIPS (8477).
Family Violence Detectives have entered Ahmorae as a missing person. Anyone with information on her whereabouts is encouraged to call Beaumont Police so that Officers can check her welfare.

**Welfare Concern- Attempt to Locate** Please Share Beaumont Police need your help locating 21 yo Ahmorae Acrond, who is possibly in danger. Ahmorae was last seen with 21 yo Chakaven Fowler in the 600 block of Adams around 1:50 p.m. See BPD’s FB page for more info!

**Suspect Alert** Can you identify him? He is the suspect in several burglaries. After burglarizing a residence, he pawns the stolen property, using the id card of an individual that is incarcerated. If you know him call BPD 832-1234 or SETX CrimeStoppers 833-TIPS

We regret to inform you of the passing of K-9 Joery, who served with BPD Officer D. Valdez for 8 years, before retiring in 2015. During K-9 Joery's retirement, he remained with Ofc. Valdez, celebrating his 14th birthday on May 1st. Thank you for your service, you will be missed!
Update #2 ** All lanes have been re-opened. Traffic is still heavily congested in both directions on I-10. Please use caution in the area as travel resumes.
*Traffic Alert* Update** Eastbound traffic is being diverted off of IH-10 at MLK. Traffic is very congested. Expect delays. Investigators will be on scene for at least one more hour.

*Traffic Alert* BPD is on the scene of a fatality involving a motorcycle on IH-10 at Magnolia. Traffic coming into Beaumont from Orange County will be diverted off IH-10 at Pine Street. Traffic traveling Eastbound on IH-10 is down to one lane. Expect delays for several hours.
#Teamwork
Come out to the @LamarSoftball Complex Friday, April 26 at 4 pm as the Lady Cards take on Nicholls, while supporting local Law Enforcement!

We can't wait to celebrate the "Back the Blue" Game with Officer Abigail!! Come out to the @LamarSoftball Complex Friday, April 26 at 4 PM and support the Lady Cardinals, your local Law Enforcement and Officer Abigail!!
Great job by our Midnight Patrol Officers! Their traffic stop could have very well thwarted a violent crime!
Join us on Friday, April 26 at 4:30 at the Lamar Softball Complex for a Back the Blue Game!! All Law Enforcement Invited!!

**New Video- 6800 Madrid Homicide** BPD would like to thank the citizens that have come forward with video footage to assist the investigation of the homicide of Anthony Wilson. If you recognize these three suspects call BPD 409-832-1234 or Crime Stoppers at 409-833-TIPS(8477).
****2nd Suspect Alert**** Please Share 6800 Madrid Homicide 2nd Suspect If anyone recognizes this suspect please call Beaumont Police at 409-832-1234
****Suspect Alert**** Please Share 6800 Madrid Homicide Suspect If anyone recognizes this suspect please call Beaumont Police at 409-832-1234
*Update* The victim’s vehicle has been located. No suspects are in custody at this time. Anyone with information is asked to call BPD at 832-1234.

6800 Madrid Homicide- residents of Dowlen West check cameras from 8 -10 pm for susp. activity. Detectives believe suspect(s) were prowling neighborhood prior to incident. It is believed that suspect(s) are in the victims white Nissan truck pulling trailer. Call 832-1234 with info
Beaumont Police are investing a homicide in the 6800 block of Madrid.
Chief Singeltary and Judge Stevens hosting the Gift of Life -Champagne & Ribs! Chief is rocking that grass skirt for a great cause! Aloha!
BPD Burglary Detectives Arrest 2!! Great Job!

BPD’s Financial Crimes Unit attending a Skimming Prevention Seminar hosted by @TXFoodandFuel. We’re learning new ways to educate our community on the techniques criminals are using to obtain cc info from skimmers & teaching store owners what they can do to assist Police.

**Update** Cardinal Dr. (Hwy 69) exit from IH-10 is now open. South/East bound traffic is moving. Fannett Road exit will remain closed for several hours. Use caution when traveling in this area, as traffic is still congested.

**Traffic Alert** BPD is working a rollover crash and HAZMAT spill on Cardinal drive at Fannett Road (South/East Bound). At this time the Cardinal Dr. (Hwy 69) exit from IH-10 is closed. Expect delays in this area for several hours!
The scene is secured. At this time, we have one confirmed homicide and 2 gun shot victims that were transported by private auto to a local hospital.
BPD is responding to a shooting at The Getaway located at 5750 S MLK. Details are limited at this time. More information will be released as it becomes available.
BPD was honored to escort Abigail to the LU Softball Game today!! #prayingfor758

**Please Share** Mark your calendars & get registered for the 35th Annual BPBA Golf Tournament!! BPBA is looking for sponsorships, donations & silent auction items!! If you're willing to help out, send us a message on FB or contact John Courts (info on flyer). Please share!!

Today, BPD Remembers Officer Danny Richmond- Killed in the Line of Duty on March 12, 1980. Officer Richmond was killed when a pickup truck hit his motorcycle head-on, while he was escorting an over-sized truck on Highway 90. Officer Richmond was 35 & served with BPD for 8 years.
**UPDATE** All 3 Suspects are in custody!
Dense fog covering many areas of Beaumont this morning. Use caution during your morning commute. Headlights on. Slow down. Leave space between vehicles! Stay safe!!
BPD is hiring- Now until March 31, 2019!! Come join our team!!

BPD & SETX ATTF have seen increase in Auto Burgs at parks & trails. Suspects seem to watch victims as they hide personal items inside their vehicle. Secure those items prior to arriving. Always be aware of surroundings & if you see someone suspicious, call BPD 409-832-1234

Happy Valentine’s Day Beaumont! Thanks to Robin Mires for creating this love note! We are happy to announce, Officer Burmaster is recovered from his crash and has been cleared for full duty! (click picture for full view)

BPD is aware of a few incidents in which women felt they were followed inside a store. We would like to remind our community to always be aware of your surroundings. If you feel you are being followed or notice someone exhibiting suspicious behavior please call BPD immediately.

BPD Det. Needs Your Help!! On 1/25/19 at 8:50 p.m. 2 suspects broke in to a business on W. Cardinal Dr. & stole a BBQ Pitt Trailer. If you know the suspects, vehicle or stolen BBQ Pitt Trailer, Call BPD at 409-832-1234 or Call Southeast Texas Crime Stoppers 409-833-TIPS (8477).
BPD Officers are Doin' Work! #busted #teamwork
Beaumont Police are working a double shooting in the 8700 block of Newfield. Both victims have been transported to a local hospital. Investigation is on-going.
**UPDATE** All travel lanes are back open.

BPD is on the scene of a Traffic Accident and HAZMAT Spill at Eastex and Tram Rd (Southbound). Traffic is being diverted off the highway at Tram Rd. Eastex will be shutdown for several hours while HAZMAT crews clean up the spill. Expect delays & use caution driving in this area.

*UPDATE* 6 of 7 suspect have been taken into custody. All have previous arrest records in Harris County, including parole, probation and one out on bond. They have also been linked with others involved in over 50 commercial burglaries in the greater Houston area in 2018 alone.

Update: Lumberton PD, Hardin County SO, Sour Lake PD, and US Marshal’s apprehended 3 of the 4 suspects who fled in Hardin County bringing the total of 6 out of 7 suspects in custody! Great job by all of our Law Enforcement Partners! #teamwork
Suspects caught by Lumberton PD and Hardin County involved in BPD early morning burglary of AT&T and vehicle Pursuit
See Something, Say Something- our citizens are being vigilant and helping catch suspects!!
Another shoutout of thanks to @nothingbundt (Beaumont, TX) and Ehrhart School for the sweet treats!! Our Officers are enjoying them! We appreciate YOU!!!
Big Thank You to reporter Kelsey Johnson and our friends at @12NewsNow for delivering kolaches and donuts for Law Enforcement Appreciation!!

The roadways are extremely wet and many areas have pockets of standing water! Use caution while driving!! Turn on your headlights. Slow Down. Leave several car lengths between you and the vehicle in front of you.

The Beaumont Police Department would like to congratulate Officer Phillip Gouthier (37 years, 7 months) and Detective Anthony Goudeau Sr. (34 years, 3 months) on their retirement!!! Thank you for your many years of dedication to serving the citizens of Beaumont & best wishes!

If you know someone who is experiencing a mental health crisis and is in need of assistance, you can follow the link below to our the new Mental Health Referral page of our website! This information is forwarded to BPD's MHLO for follow up.

Safety tips to ring in the New Year: Drink Responsibly- Get a ride! NO celebratory gunfire! 8 pm - 2 am alcohol related crashes are highest. It is ILLEGAL to pop fireworks in Bmt!! Keep pets safe, inside during the holiday. B.P.D. wishes you a safe and Happy New Year!
Merry Christmas from your Beaumont Police 2nd Watch, Christmas Day, Patrol Officers!

BPD investigating a shooting that occurred at Honey’s Drive-in located at 3111 Concord. One victim transported to a local hospital. A person of interest has been detained. Traffic is congested in the area, please use caution. More information will be released at a later time.

BPD is encouraging safe driving during the holidays by increased enforcement on DWIs 12/15-12/31. With 3,000+ deaths on TX roads in 2018, our goal is to reduce traffic crashes & fatalities involving impaired drivers. #DontDrinkAndDrive
BPD's Basketball Team participating in the Hoops for Toys Event last Sunday! @JCSO_Texas #ThisishowweBeaumont #communitypolicing #HoopsforToys #Communityunity #BeaumontPDTX

There are many different types of scams. Please do not purchase anything or provide payment information over the phone! PDs, Entergy, IRS, SS, etc. do not accept Google Play or gift cards as forms of payment and will not contact by phone Report scams to http://www.ftc.gov
Today, The Beaumont Police Department remembers Officer Byron Merritt, killed in the line of duty on December 17, 1905. #neverforget #officerdown #ultimatesacrifice

**BUSTED** Thanks to a "suspicious person" call from a vigilant citizen, 2 were arrested early this morning in the 4600 block of Collier. Guns & Drugs located, thanks to the assistance of K-9 Gus! Check out the press release here. https://beaumonttexas.gov/suspicious-person-call-leads-to-2-arrests-weapons-drug-seizure-4600-collier/ #seesomethingsaysomething
Update on multiple Bomb Threats
BPD has a great working relationship with our federal partners @FBIHouston and @ATFHou. Our officers will continue to protect and serve the City of Beaumont. #seesomethingsaysomething

We have received several additional calls of Bomb Threats at multiple locations in the city. We are investigating these threats with our local, state, and federal partners as is standard protocol. This investigation is on going. Stay tuned to our twitter for updates.
BPD is responding to a call of a bomb threat in the 7800 block of Eastex Freeway. Details are limited at this time more information to follow please stay tuned to our Twitter.
BPD investigating Burglary of a residence Westmoreland & 4th St.

BPD is working a Burglary-in-Progress in near Westmoreland and 4th St. 2 Suspects. One is in Custody and Police are searching the area for the second suspect. If you are in the area, be vigilant and call in any suspicious person. Stay tuned to our Twitter, more info to follow.

Come out to Sterling Pruitt this Sunday for the Hoops for Toys Event!! The BPD Basketball Team will face off with @JCSO_Texas Basketball Team and others!! #thisishowweBeaumont #BPDBasketball #CommunityPolicing #BeaumontPD

**SUSPECT ALERT** Smile, you're on camera.... Do you know this suspect? On 12/2/18, he stole copper wiring from a biz in Bmt. If you know his name, call BPD 409-832-1234, msg us on FB, or call Setx Crime Stoppers 409-833-TIPS #BeaumontPD #Suspectalert #caughtoncamera #cheese

BPD investigating more "jugging" cases! Suspects watch potential victims leave a bank after withdrawing cash, then burglarize vehicle and steal money! Stay alert! Secure cash INSIDE bank! Don't leave cash in your vehicle. Watch your surroundings #seesomethingsaysomething #BPDTX

After media training at FBI-Houston, BPD is going to be transitioning to a more active presence on Twitter!! Retweet this post and help us reach more followers! Our Twitter page will be your "go to" for instant information on active events plus much more!! #BeaumontTXPD

BPD is looking for 8 yo Chaston Victoria, who ran away from his home in the 5300 block of E. Parkway at midnight. He was last seen wearing a red shirt, black shorts & no shoes, walking on Highland. please keep an eye out for this child & call 911 if you see him.

BPD is looking for 10 yo Cameron Lomax, who ran away from Crow Road at 6 p.m. He was wearing khaki pants, red shirt, camo jacket, & blue shoes. 7p.m., He was seen near Parkdale Mall. Dowlen/Eastex/Crow etc., please keep an eye out for this child & call 911 if you locate him.
All lanes have been reopened

BPD is working a major traffic crash in the 7200 block of Washington Blvd. ALL Traffic lanes on Washington Blvd. from Langham to Burbank are closed at this time. Please take alternate routes and use caution in this area. We will update when lanes are back open.
BPD will host 4 FREE public safety seminars the last week of Nov & first week of Dec. Join us at a community center near you!!

**TODAY AT 10 AM** We still have spots available for this seminar!! Come out to the BPD Training Classroom & learn some valuable tips to keep you, your business, your employees and your customers safe!!! Detectives will be available to answer all of your questions! See you there

BPD is hosting TWO Workplace Safety & Crime Prevention Seminar for Business Owners, Managers, and Employees!! Dates are 11/7/18 & 11/13/18. The seminars are completely FREE!! Seating is limited- email haley.morrow@beaumonttexas.gov or call 409-730-4434 to reserve your seat today!
**REMINDER** Police Community Forum TONIGHT, Thursday, November 1 at 7:00 PM at Temple of Praise Church of God in Christ!!! It's Our Community, Let's Keep Talking!!

Major crash and HAZMAT spill on I10 Westbound in front of Ford Park. This crash involves multiple vehicles and 3 confirmed fatalities. I10 Westbound Traffic is being detoured off of I10 at Brooks Rd, onto the service road and back on I10 after Major D. Use caution, expect delays
https://beaumonttexas.gov/beaumont-police-investigating-two-overnight-aggravated-robberies/

Beaumont Police are working an active SWAT scene of a barricaded subject in the 9100 block of Landis. Landis at Perlstein Park and Landis at Wooten are blocked at this time. Please avoid this area as we attempt to bring this situation to a peaceful resolution.

Beaumont PD wants to remind our community if you see something, say something. If you see anything that looks suspicious or out of place, please do not touch it. Keep a safe distance and call 911. We are working with our Law Enforcement partners at @FBIHouston and @ATFHou.

The Beaumont Police Department has been made aware of a video circulating social media depicting child pornography. In the event that this disturbing video comes across your social media account, DO NOT SHARE IT! Please see the BPD Facebook Page for more information.

Traffic Update- Eastex Freeway The overpasses on Eastex Freeway are iced over. However, there is still rock on the ground allowing vehicles to pass. Barricades are down north and south bound but we urge drivers to use extreme caution.

NWS is predicting a chance of freezing rain along and north of IH-10 1.16.18. Rain will begin late tonight and continue tom w/ temps near freezing by 10 A.M. Any accumulations of ice on bridges and elevated roadways will linger until mid-day Wednesday. Visit BPD FB for more info.

Beaumont Police are on the scene of an Auto-Pedistrian Accident in the 6100 block of HWY 69 South between HWY 347 and Expresso Bay. This is a possible fatality so BPD Crash Investigators are on scene investigating. Please use alternate routes

BPD would like to wish Detective Lisa Jardine a Happy Retirement! Det. Jardine served the citizens of the City of Beaumont for 30 years! 10 years on Patrol, 5 years in Traffic and 15 years as Det. Thank you Det. Jardine for your dedication to service! You will be missed!

BPD would like to wish a Happy Retirement to Sgt. Al Johnson. Sgt. Johnson proudly served our Citizens for 37 years! He was a member of the SWAT Team for 35 years and is widely known as "K9- Liz's Handler". Thank you Sgt. Johnson for your dedication to service. You will be missed

Today, The Beaumont Police Department remembers Officer Revis J. Landry- Killed in the line of duty on December 4, 1945. Officer Landry was killed when his patrol car struck the rear of a railroad boxcar. Officer Landry was 34 years old and had served with BPD for four months.
